reviewText: Old fashion Martial Arts before Bruce Lee style movies
It's an OK martial arts film. I was expecting it to be better choreographed.

The movie itself is a good copy from original transfer. The has great action and the plot flows with the character smoothly as the story develops. This is a great example of the genre and a great addition to your Fu collection.
Its not just fighting, its the well directed drama.

Great action. Great Kung Fu. Would like to see more of Hwang Jang Lee's signature kicks, although he probably wouldn't have died at the end if he used them all. Didn't mean to give away the ending, but he dies in every movie, almost.
One of the best martail art moves that I haye seen.
One of the best action packed  Martial Arts fight movies of all time. A real good show of the different hand movements and Techniques
Perfect example of this genre. You'll love it!
A classic of the genre with all the elements that make these films enjoyable.

This is one of the top Kung Fu films that wasn't either Shaw Brothers or Golden Harvest. The choreography isn't quite on par with the best examples of the era, but it has frequent and enjoyable sequences of action, and the iron armor gimmick is really fun. On top of that, it has a surprisingly engaging story about a wrongfully accused man who has to set things right... with help from unexpected places.

The characters are cool in that goofy Kung Fu flick way, and if you meet the movie on its level (low-budget but awesome), you'll have a really good time. Highly recommended!
You just gotta love these old martial arts films. I would take off of the bad dubbing but it's just too funny not to give it 5 stars.
